attribs.name: personality_traits
attribs.current:
I enjoy sitting in quiet solitude.

I talk about my family a lot.

attribs.name: ideals
attribs.current: Balance. I see life and death every day on the farm, and I know everything is a circle. (Neutral)

attribs.name: bonds
attribs.current: I want to be the best at what I do.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MV7Gs8rZSoZtR2MHNXj_description
attribs.current: Druids will not wear armor or use shields that are made of metal.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MV7Gs8rZSoZtR2MHNXk_description
attribs.current: You know Druidic, the secret language of druids. You can speak the language and use it to leave hidden messages. You and others who know this language automatically spot such a message. Others spot the message's presence with a successful DC 15 Wisdom (Perception) check but can't decipher it without magic.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MV7Gs8rZSoZtR2MHNXl_description
attribs.current: You can cast a druid spell as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag and you have the spell prepared.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MV7Gs8u9HhhWNHpsgvJ_description
attribs.current: When you roll a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MV7Gs8u9HhhWNHpsgvK_description
attribs.current: You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MV7Gs8u9HhhWNHpsgvL_description
attribs.current: You can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than yours.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MV7Gs8vI20OdQK03D6R_description
attribs.current: You can attempt to hide even when you are obscured only by a creature that is at least one size larger than you.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MV7Gs8wxFCw3j1UXZEL_description
attribs.current: You know farms and farm life well, and other farmers may very well know your family’s farm and reputation. In any area of farmland you can always find friendly lodging of some sort. Additionally, you and any companions can always gain employment as day laborers with payment of 5 sp each person per day, in addition to food and lodging.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MV7Gs8zKncLld2ZVrNJ_itemname
attribs.current: a horse OR ox and wagon

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MV7Gs9-FBp3ZU5khM2e_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Melee Weapon, Damage: 1d4, Damage Type: Piercing, Range: 20/60,Critical Range: 20,Critical Range: 20

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MV7Gs9-FBp3ZU5khM2f_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Melee Weapon, Damage: 1d6, Damage Type: Piercing, Alternate Damage: 1d8, Alternate Damage Type: Piercing, Range: 20/60,Critical Range: 20

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MV7Gs9-FBp3ZU5khM2g_itemcontent
attribs.current: The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil. The rest of the armor is made of softer and more flexible materials.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MV7Gs90Ul4IN-SV-1fg_itemcontent
attribs.current: Rope, whether made of hemp or silk, has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-MV7Gs91zfoJ0sYzFb5L_spelldescription
attribs.current: Whispering to the spirits of nature, you create one of the following effects within range: You create a tiny, harmless sensory effect that predicts what the weather will be at your location for the next 24 hours. The effect might manifest as a golden orb for clear skies, a cloud for rain, falling snowflakes for snow, and so on. This effect persists for 1 round. You instantly make a flower blossom, a seed pod open, or a leaf bud bloom. You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as falling leaves, a puff of wind, the sound of a small animal, or the faint odor of skunk. The effect must fit in a 5-foot cube. You instantly light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-MV7Gs91zfoJ0sYzFb5N_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the Healing increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1st.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-MV7Gs91zfoJ0sYzFb5N_spelldescription
attribs.current: A creature you touch regains a number of hit points equal to 1d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-MV7Gs91zfoJ0sYzFb5P_spelldescription
attribs.current:
You touch a tree and ask one question about anything that might have happened in its immediate vicinity (such as “Who passed by here?”). You get a mental sensation of the response, which lasts for the duration of the spell. Trees do not have a humanoid’s sense of time, so the tree might speak about something that happened last night or a hundred years ago. The sensation you receive might include sight, hearing, vibration, or smell, all from the tree’s perspective. Trees are particularly attentive to anything that might harm the forest and always report such activities when questioned.
If you cast this spell on a tree that contains a creature that can merge with trees, such as a dryad, you can freely communicate with the merged creature for the duration of the spell.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MV7Gs92XgetL9HgrIH-_itemcontent
attribs.current: A backpack can hold one cubic foot or 30 pounds of gear. You can also strap items, such as a bedroll or a coil of rope, to the outside of a backpack.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MV7Gs93jV8fmNJ6yzvp_itemcontent
attribs.current: This tin box contains a cup and simple cutlery. The box clamps together, and one side can be used as a cooking pan and the other as a plate or shallow bowl.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MV7Gs93jV8fmNJ6yzvq_itemcontent
attribs.current: This small container holds flint, fire steel, and tinder (usually dry cloth soaked in light oil) used to kindle a fire. Using it to light a torch - or anything else with abundant, exposed fuel - takes an action. Lighting any other fire takes 1 minute.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MV7Gs93jV8fmNJ6yzvr_itemcontent
attribs.current: A torch burns for 1 hour, providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. If you make a melee attack with a burning torch and hit, it deals 1 fire damage.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MV7Gs93jV8fmNJ6yzvr_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Adventuring Gear, Damage: 1, Damage Type: Fire, Range: 20/40

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MV7Gs93jV8fmNJ6yzvs_itemcontent
attribs.current: Rations consist of dry foods suitable for extended travel, including jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MV7Gs93jV8fmNJ6yzvt_itemcontent
attribs.current: A waterskin can hold up to 4 pints of liquid.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MV7Gs93jV8fmNJ6yzvu_itemcontent
attribs.current: Rope, whether made of hemp or silk, has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-MV7Si0WWPL1a2g-MfEU_spelldescription
attribs.current:
You seize the air and compel it to create one of the following effects at a point you can see within range:

    One Medium or smaller creature that you choose must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 5 feet away from you.

    You create a small blast of air capable of moving one object that is neither held nor carried and that weighs no more than 5 pounds. The object is pushed up to 10 feet away from you. It isn’t pushed with enough force to cause damage.

    You create a harmless sensory effect using air, such as causing leaves to rustle, wind to slam shutters shut, or your clothing to ripple in a breeze.
